reporter_caption.center: MOORE v. CMWLTH. LAND TITLE, 303 S.W.3d 654 (Mo.App.E.D. 2010)

caption.center: James C. MOORE and Luz B. Elfiki, Plaintiffs/Respondents, v. COMMONWEALTH

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District.

opinion.opinion_text: [EDITORS' NOTE: THIS OPINION IS SUBJECT TO MODIFICATION OR TRANSFER TO THE SUPREME COURT.]
opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court of St. Louis County, 08SL-CC00281, Michael T. Jamison, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
William L. Sauerwein, Trenton K. Bon, J. Adam Stockberger, Sauerwein, Simon Blanchard, P.C., St. Louis, MO, for Appellant.
Steven M. Hamburg, Steven M. Hamburg, P.C., Clayton, MO, for Respondent.
opinion.panel:
Before GLENN A. NORTON, P.J., MARY K. HOFF, J., and LAWRENCE E. MOONEY, J.
Prior report: 2009 WL 2206964.
opinion.opinion_text:
Commonwealth Land Title Insurance Company appeals from the trial court's judgment entered upon a jury verdict in favor of James C. Moore and Luz B. Elfiki (collectively Homeowners) on Homeowners' Petition alleging breach of fiduciary duty and negligence.[fn1]
We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal. No error of law appears. Rule 84.16(b)(5). An extended opinion reciting the detailed factsPage 655 and restating the principles of law would have no precedential value. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth our reasons for the order affirming the trial court's award of summary judgment, pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
[fn1] Only the claim of breach of fiduciary duty was submitted to the jury.
